thread.title: The Great Gieseke: Hannibal senior leads swim team while breaking records
thread.title_full: The Great Gieseke: Hannibal senior leads swim team while breaking records

author: Ben Marth
title: The Great Gieseke: Hannibal senior leads swim team while breaking records
text:
The Great Gieseke: Hannibal senior leads swim team while breakin - WGEM.com: Quincy News, Weather, Sports, and Radio Member Center: The Great Gieseke: Hannibal senior leads swim team while breaking records Posted: Hannibal senior Lliot Gieseke broke his own 50 and 100-yard freestyle school records last weekend in Columbia. 
HANNIBAL, Mo. (WGEM) -- Who said Pirates can't swim?Last Saturday the Hannibal swim team met more than 500 swimmers at the COMO invitational at the Mizzou Aquatic Complex.It was Hannibal's Lliot Gieseke who won titles in the 50 and 100 yard freestyle events."It just made made me happy to know that I've been getting better after all my years of swimming," Gieseke said.Gieseke was swimming in familiar water. His times in Columbia broke his own school records. "I don't really go swimming to break records," he explained."I just swim to be the fastest person out there." Along with Gieseke the Pirates 200 freestyle relay qualified for the state meet as well.The success at the COMO Invitational is just part of what the Pirates are trying to accomplish as they attempt to build a team full of young talent."The freshmen are working hard because the seniors are working hard," head coach Brenda Hallbauer said."They want to be where the seniors are but they have a long way to go to get there." It all means the future is bright for this band of Pirates "Hopefully we'll bring in those young ones, the sophomores and freshmen, to where they are making state cuts" Hallbauer explained.The Pirates aren't done trying to qualify more events for state.The hope is at least two more relays will get a chance to swim on Missouri's biggest stage in St. Peter's in early November.
